trans-unit.source: Creating a New Software Driver
trans-unit.target: Creating a New Software Driver

trans-unit.source: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new software driver.
trans-unit.target: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new software driver.

trans-unit.source: Software drivers are different from device function drivers, filter drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.
trans-unit.target: Software drivers are different from device function drivers, filter drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.

trans-unit.source: For more information about software drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see [What is a Driver?](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554678) and [Choosing a Driver Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554652).
trans-unit.target: For more information about software drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see [What is a Driver?](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554678) and [Choosing a Driver Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554652).

trans-unit.source: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your software driver.
trans-unit.target: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your software driver.

trans-unit.source: The three options are the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), the legacy NT driver model, and the Windows Driver Model (WDM).
trans-unit.target: The three options are the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), the legacy NT driver model, and the Windows Driver Model (WDM).

trans-unit.source: For help determining which model is best for you, see [Choosing a Driver Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554652).
trans-unit.target: For help determining which model is best for you, see [Choosing a Driver Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554652).

trans-unit.source: Case 1: You want to use KMDF.
trans-unit.target: Case 1: You want to use KMDF.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select **WDF**.
trans-unit.target: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select **WDF**.

trans-unit.source: In the middle pane, select **Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF)**.
trans-unit.target: In the middle pane, select **Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF)**.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see [Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439654).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see [Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439654).

trans-unit.source: **Note** When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.
trans-unit.target: **Note** When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.

trans-unit.source: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.
trans-unit.target: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.

trans-unit.source: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your software driver.
trans-unit.target: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your software driver.

trans-unit.source: Case 2: You want to use the legacy NT model.
trans-unit.target: Case 2: You want to use the legacy NT model.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under **Windows Driver**, select **WDM | Empty WDM Driver.**
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under **Windows Driver**, select **WDM | Empty WDM Driver.**

trans-unit.source: **Note** You are not going to write a WDM driver, but you need the **Empty WDM Driver** template.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You are not going to write a WDM driver, but you need the **Empty WDM Driver** template.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose **Add | New Item**.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose **Add | New Item**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add New Item dialog box, select **C++ File (.cpp)**, enter a name for your file, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the Add New Item dialog box, select **C++ File (.cpp)**, enter a name for your file, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the **.c** extension.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the **.c** extension.

trans-unit.source: Include ntddk.h.
trans-unit.target: Include ntddk.h.

trans-unit.source: Implement the functions required by your software driver.
trans-unit.target: Implement the functions required by your software driver.

trans-unit.source: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
trans-unit.target: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.

trans-unit.source: Case 3: You want to use WDM.
trans-unit.target: Case 3: You want to use WDM.

trans-unit.source: It is extremely unlikely that you'll want to use WDM for a software driver.
trans-unit.target: It is extremely unlikely that you'll want to use WDM for a software driver.

trans-unit.source: But if you do, follow these steps.
trans-unit.target: But if you do, follow these steps.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, on the **File** menu, choose **New | Project**.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under **Windows Driver**, select **WDM.**
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under **Windows Driver**, select **WDM.**

trans-unit.source: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the **Name** and **Location** boxes, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose **Add | New Item**.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose **Add | New Item**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add New Item dialog box, select **C++ File (.cpp)**, enter a name for your file, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the Add New Item dialog box, select **C++ File (.cpp)**, enter a name for your file, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the **.c** extension.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the **.c** extension.

trans-unit.source: Include wdm.h.
trans-unit.target: Include wdm.h.

trans-unit.source: Implement the functions required by your software driver.
trans-unit.target: Implement the functions required by your software driver.

trans-unit.source: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
trans-unit.target: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
